senses.de: To limit or control something or someone, or the freedom to do something
senses.ex: The government passed the law to restrict smoking in public places.

Tips.title: Authority Imposed
Tips.description: Usually indicates a higher power or authority imposing rules or limits.
Tips.example: The library will restrict noise levels during exams.

Tips.title: Negative Emotion
Tips.description: Often carries a negative feeling, as freedoms or actions are being limited.
Tips.example: Players felt restricted by the new team rules.

Tips.title: Common Collocations
Tips.description: Learn common phrases like 'restrict access' to grasp usage in daily situations.
Tips.example: The museum restricted access to the rare collection.

senses.de: To confine or keep within certain limits
senses.ex: The training program was restricted to a few select participants.

Tips.title: Legal Boundaries
Tips.description: Used to describe legal limitations, often found in contracts or regulations.
Tips.example: The contract restricts the use of the property to residential purposes only.

Tips.title: Formal Context
Tips.description: Used in more formal contexts such as legal, corporate, or academic settings.
Tips.example: The terms of agreement restrict our options significantly.

senses.ex: The disease restricted him from leading a normal life.

Tips.title: Medical Constraints
Tips.description: Used to express limitations due to health or medical conditions.
Tips.example: Her allergies restrict her diet to gluten-free foods.

Tips.title: Circumstantial Barrier
Tips.description: It implies an obstacle created by circumstances, not always by choice.
Tips.example: Blizzard conditions restricted travel across the state.

senses.de: To limit the amount or range of something
senses.ex: The company needs to restrict its spending.

Tips.title: Business Constraints
Tips.description: Common in business to talk about limiting spending, supply, or other resources.
Tips.example: The budget restricts our marketing campaign options.

Tips.title: Scope Limitation
Tips.description: Expresses a narrowing down of options or possibilities.
Tips.example: Our limited resources restrict the scope of the project.

Bound.wordDefinition:
Bound means to be limited or tied to a certain set of rules or expectations. This can refer to physical limitations like being bound to stay within certain boundaries or metaphorical limitations like being bound to a code of conduct or set of expectations.

So, in simple terms, bound refers to being limited by rules or expectations, while restrict refers to limiting someone's actions or access to things.

Circumscribe.wordDefinition:
Circumscribe means to draw a line around something or to limit something by drawing a line around it. It is applicable when we want to describe the boundaries or limits of something, like drawing a border on a map or outlining the rules that one must follow.

Circumscribe is used when we want to describe the boundaries or limits of something while restrict is used when we want to limit the freedom or activity of something.

Confine.wordDefinition:
Confine means to physically limit or restrict someone or something within certain boundaries or limits. For example, a prisoner is confined to his jail cell or a dog is confined to a fenced yard.

So, in simple terms, confine relates to physical limits and boundaries, while restrict relates to a limit on actions or behavior.

Constrain.wordDefinition:
The words constrain and restrict are used to describe limitations or limitations on something.

However, constrain is used when something is limited or restricted due to external factors or circumstances beyond its control.

For instance, a company may be constrained by government regulations or limited by its available resources.

Constrain implies that there is little or no control over the limitation, while restrict implies that a person or group is making a conscious decision to limit something.

Control.wordDefinition:
Control means to manage or regulate something in order to achieve a desired outcome or maintain order. For example, a teacher may control the classroom to ensure students are focused on their work.

Control is more about influencing or directing something towards a desired result, while restrict is more about limiting or preventing certain actions or behaviors.

Control is applicable in situations where a degree of management is needed to reach a specific goal, while restrict is applicable in situations where limits need to be set to avoid negative consequences.

Curtail.wordDefinition:
Curtail means to reduce or cut back on something, usually to save money or resources. For example, a company might curtail its spending on office supplies in order to save money.

Curtail refers to reducing or cutting back on something, while restrict refers to placing limits or restrictions on something.

Both words can be used in a variety of situations, but usually curtail is used more in the context of finances or resources, while restrict is used more in the context of rules or regulations.

Limit.wordDefinition:
Limit refers to something that is fixed or determined, and cannot go beyond a certain point. For instance, if you say "I will eat only one cookie", then you are setting a limit on the number of cookies you will eat.

Restrict means to place limits or control on something. If you say "I will restrict myself to one cookie per day", then you are setting a rule on how many cookies you can eat every day.

Limit refers to a boundary or boundary condition, while restrict refers to an action taken to create a boundary or boundary condition.

You would use limit to describe the actual barrier or point beyond which something cannot go, and restrict to describe the action you take to create that barrier or point.

Regulate.wordDefinition:
Regulate means to control or manage something to ensure that it is done in a safe and proper way. For example, the government may regulate the amount of pollution that factories are allowed to release into the air.

The main difference between the two words is that regulate generally implies a positive action taken to ensure safety and compliance with rules, whereas restrict generally implies a negative action taken to limit behavior or access.

Regulate is typically used when there is some kind of standard or guideline that needs to be maintained, while restrict is used to prevent certain activities or behaviors from happening.

Restrain.wordDefinition:
Restrain means to physically or mentally control someone or something from doing a certain action or behavior.

For example, if a person is angry and wants to punch someone, but someone else grabs their arm and holds them back, they are being restrained.

To summarize, restrain is more about physically controlling a person or thing, while restrict is more about setting limitations on actions or behaviors.
